jam.sort
Class RingBuffer

java.lang.Object
  jam.sort.RingBuffer
public class RingBuffer
extends java.lang.Object

RingBuffer is a list of buffers which starts repeating after the last buffer is filled. It allows asyncronous inter-Thread communication. If a buffer is placed in a full ring, an exception is thrown.

Since:
JDK 1.1
Version:
0.5,0.9
Author:
Ken Swartz

Method Detail

putBuffer

public void putBuffer(byte[] inBuffer)
               throws jam.sort.RingFullException
Copies the passed array into the ring buffer.

Throws:
RingFullException - thrown when the ring is too full to be written to

getBuffer

public byte[] getBuffer()
Gives a pointer to the next buffer in the ring.

Returns:
the next buffer in the ring

empty

public boolean empty()
Tells you if the ring buffer is empty. Used to check if you have read all the buffers in the ring.

Returns:
true if there are no buffers in the ring.
